# USERNAME -> amcdanymx


#### Description

Oracles can be your best friend, they will decrypt anything, except the flag's ciphertext. How will you break it? Connect with `nc mercury.picoctf.net 10333`.



#### Pistas
What can you do with a different pair of ciphertext and plaintext? What if it is not so different after all...
 
#### SOLUCIÓN

Volvemos a trabajar con la teoría de RSA, en esta ocación vemos que no tiene padding el mensaje cifrado, al no tenerlo cualquier operación sobre un mensaje cifrado y lo desenciptamos y le palicamos una operación inversa se obtiene la llave en este caso la bandera:

```
Welcome to the Padding Oracle Challenge

This oracle will take anything you give it and decrypt using RSA. It will not accept the ciphertext with the secret message... Good Luck!

n: 

e: 65537
ciphertext: 

Give me ciphertext to decrypt: 

Here you go: 580550060391700078946913236734911770139931497702556153513487440893406629034802718534645538074938502890768853279675297196794

Give me ciphertext to decrypt:

```



```
>>> e = 65537

>>> c = 

>>> x = pow(2,e,n)

>>> x



>>> c * x



>>> m = 580550060391700078946913236734911770139931497702556153513487440893406629034802718534645538074938502890768853279675297196794 // 2

>>> from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes
>>> long_to_bytes(m)

b'picoCTF{m4yb3_Th0se_m3s54g3s_4r3_difurrent_1772735}'
```

y obtenemos la bandera:
```
picoCTF{m4yb3_Th0se_m3s54g3s_4r3_difurrent_1772735}

```
